abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Water and Power Development
            Authority (WAPDA) Power Project in Pakistan was successfully
            completed. The Bank maintained good relations with the
            Borrower and the Beneficiary during loan processing and
            project implementation. The Project was entirely
            satisfactory in that the power transmission facilities were
            completed, and are functioning properly. This work was done
            at a substantially lower cost than was originally estimated.
            Eventually almost US$20 million of the Loan had to be
            cancelled. Financially, WAPDA's position had improved
            considerably by the time the Project was completed. This was
            the result of tariff increases generally following the plan
            devised by the Bank at appraisal. Thus, WAPDA's
            progress during the Project was mixed. It was quite adequate
            in the context of the Project, but in broader terms,
            fundamental problems remain to be resolved, specifically,
            the ones noted above. These are being addressed under the
            Fourth and Fifth Power Projects, and the Energy Sector Loan.
